readingMnemonic: You imagined being back in time too good and now you're stuck using an <kanji>axe</kanji> to be a <kanji>bread loaf counter</kanji> for the <reading>Kin</reading>g (きん) of England. You aren't sure which king he is or when in time you are, but he's mean and keeps eating all the bread you cut up with your axe.
meaningMnemonic: The <radical>axe</radical> radical and the <kanji>axe</kanji> kanji are exactly the same, with one minor difference. This kanji is also used as the <kanji>bread loaf counter</kanji>, probably because bread was so big and hard in the past that they had to use axes to slice them.
